common_questions: Why do you want to look for a new job if the pay is great and experience is decent so far?
Why did you take the job then if you don't like ServiceNow and interviewing for projects?
What jobs are you thinking about looking for?
What do you want us to tell you?
what is your assessment of my performance", "would you be able to connect with me on LinkedI
interview_tips: some of you vets could give to someone who's just starting off in this business
is if you're already this undecided about what you want to do, do the leadership development program
to read through the job description carefully and prepare examples of how your skills align with the requirements
to mention your experience with data analysis in Excel and your communication skills, as these are specifically mentioned in the job description
ServiceNow (SDE Internship) vs Walmart Global Tech (SWE Internship)
would be greatly appreciated! I've asked a handful of people and they've all been swayed by the money for ServiceNow
Walmart especially if you would be working for a team in Bentonville
red_flags: be afraid to put pressure on them to recognize your skills (within reasonable social limits)
get a second chance with them haha
pass all the questions (or rather fail 1 question in this case), will I be automatically rejected?
did one day of programming or software dev
drug test also have government contracts, right? Salesforce certainly does; so do Google/Oracle and others, and none of them do drug tests
even know what I should be applying for
let one rejection stop you; you'll probably go through 20+ rejections before you get a job offer
hesitate to ask questions during the interview

process_insights.format: Mix of technical, behavioral, on-site, virtual
